page.title: 16Homes in the Calverton Area
page.content: Calverton is sparseley populated.Well maintained, renovated cottages are historically interesting and line one street.Most are stone built.Some have thatched roofs and exposed beams.Three alms houses remain. Older "one-up,one-down" cottages are situated by the factory in Deanshanger.Their walls are brick,stone or whitewash with sash window.Behind those lie semi-detached council houses characterised by half brick and half pebble-dash walls. Windows have small panes of glass. Some have been purchased and extended.Many bungalows surround the town.The newest development of light brick semi-detached have large windows and glass doors.Stony Sratford's homes range from Victorian terraced with red bricks to light brick detached houses with integral garages.
